alert.note: Alert for Lower Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:11PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lafourche Parish through 545 PM CDT... At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Deep Lake and Catfish Lake near Golden Meadow, or 8 miles south of Galliano, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Galliano and Golden Meadow. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
